name: Mistral Vibe 2.0
description: A major upgrade to Mistral's terminal-native AI coding agent, powered by the Devstral 2 model family. Features custom subagents, multi-choice clarifications, slash-command skills, and unified agent modes. Moves from open-source to paid Le Chat Pro/Team plans.

name: Ai2 Open Coding Agents (SERA)
description: Open-source family of AI developer agents from Allen Institute for AI, starting with SERA (Soft-Verified Efficient Repository Agents). Designed to adapt to any codebase with 11x lower training costs. Released with full source code, 200,000 synthetic trajectories, and tools for customization.
community_quotes: Fast, accessible coding agents that adapt to any repository
Cuts training costs by up to 11 times

name: Kilo Code Reviewer
description: Open-source AI code review agent for JetBrains IDEs that achieved #1 Product of the Day on Product Hunt with 658 upvotes. Automatically activates when opening Pull Requests to provide AI-powered code reviews. Completely free with MiniMax M2.1 model.
community_quotes: #1 Product of the Day on Product Hunt
Replaced tools like Cursor, Cline, and Continue for many users
Surprisingly data aware, not just code aware
Fewer retries and better control over rules, memory, and cost

name: Kimi Code
description: Open-source CLI coding agent launched by China's Moonshot AI alongside the Kimi K2.5 model. A terminal-based AI coding tool positioned as a rival to Claude Code and Gemini CLI, with support for VSCode, Cursor, and Zed integration.
community_quotes: Open-source alternative to Claude Code and Gemini CLI
Can spawn up to 100 AI agents for coordinated work

name: OpenAI Prism
description: A free AI workspace for scientific writing and coding launched by OpenAI. LaTeX-native workspace integrated with ChatGPT and powered by GPT-5.2, designed specifically for researchers and scientists to 'vibe code' scientific work.
community_quotes: Free for anyone with a ChatGPT account

name: yolo-cage
description: Security-focused AI coding agent framework featured on Show HN. Prevents AI agents from exfiltrating secrets or merging their own PRs without human approval. Kubernetes-based autonomous coding with branch isolation and secret scanning. Notably, the AI wrote its own containment system.
community_quotes: The AI wrote its own containment system from inside the system's own prototype
Defense in depth - even if the cage code is AI-written and imperfect, it still creates a barrier
When sandboxed correctly, this mode is actually safer than conventional approaches
